questions.q: Which organization created the OSI model?
questions.explanation: The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) developed the OSI model in 1984.

questions.q: How many layers are in the OSI model?
questions.explanation: The OSI model consists of 7 layers: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, and Application.

questions.q: Which OSI layer is responsible for converting data into a format suitable for transmission (including encryption and compression)?
questions.explanation: The Presentation layer ensures that data is in a usable format and is where data encryption occurs.

questions.q: Which OSI layer handles logical addressing (like IP addresses)?
questions.explanation: The Network layer handles logical addressing and routing.

questions.q: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating connections?
questions.explanation: The Session layer manages the sessions (connections) between different applications.

questions.q: The Data Link layer is also known as which layer in the TCP/IP model?
questions.explanation: In the 4-layer TCP/IP model, the Link layer (or Network Interface) combines the OSI Physical and Data Link layers.

questions.q: Which layer of the OSI model deals with voltage levels and cable specifications?
questions.explanation: The Physical layer defines hardware, cabling, and the electrical signals used to transmit bits.

questions.q: Which TCP/IP layer corresponds to the Transport layer in OSI?
questions.explanation: The Transport layer in both models handles end-to-end communication (TCP/UDP).

questions.q: Which device operates at the Network layer?
questions.explanation: Routers use IP addresses at the Network layer to determine the best path for data packets.

questions.q: Encapsulation adds information to data as it travels ______ the OSI stack.
questions.explanation: As data moves from Application down to Physical, each layer adds its own header (encapsulation).

questions.q: Which OSI layer ensures end-to-end communication and data segmentation?
questions.explanation: The Transport layer is responsible for breaking data into segments and ensuring reliable delivery.

questions.q: Which protocol operates at the Application layer?
questions.explanation: HTTP is used by web browsers at the Application layer.

questions.q: Which layer is responsible for detecting and correcting Physical layer errors?
questions.explanation: The Data Link layer uses frames and checksums (FCS) to detect errors in the physical transmission.

questions.q: Which of the following is not a layer in the TCP/IP model?
questions.explanation: The TCP/IP model does not have a separate Presentation or Session layer; these functions are handled by the Application layer.

questions.q: The OSI model is primarily used today as:
options: A way to describe network architecture
questions.explanation: The OSI model is a theoretical reference model used for teaching and troubleshooting.

questions.q: Which layer translates data between network and application formats?
questions.explanation: The Presentation layer acts as a translator for the network.

questions.q: Which layer uses MAC addresses?
questions.explanation: Media Access Control (MAC) addresses are used at Layer 2 (Data Link).

questions.q: In TCP/IP, which layer combines OSI’s Presentation and Session layers?
questions.explanation: The Application layer in TCP/IP encompasses the top three layers of the OSI model.

questions.q: Which OSI layer provides node-to-node connectivity?
questions.explanation: The Data Link layer handles communication between two directly connected nodes.

questions.q: Which TCP/IP layer includes HTTP and FTP?
questions.explanation: High-level protocols like HTTP and FTP reside in the Application layer.

questions.q: Which OSI layer is closest to the user?
questions.explanation: The Application layer interacts directly with software applications used by humans.

questions.q: Which of these is a Transport layer protocol?
questions.explanation: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) is the primary Layer 4 protocol.

questions.q: Which OSI layer manages dialogues between applications?
questions.explanation: The Session layer establishes and checkpoints dialogues between hosts.

questions.q: Which TCP/IP layer handles routing and logical addressing?
questions.explanation: The Internet layer of TCP/IP is equivalent to the OSI Network layer.

questions.q: Which device works at the Data Link layer?
questions.explanation: Switches process frames based on MAC addresses at Layer 2.

questions.q: Which OSI layer is responsible for breaking data into segments?
questions.explanation: Data is called 'Segments' at the Transport layer.

questions.q: In the OSI model, the PDU at the Network layer is called:
questions.explanation: PDU stands for Protocol Data Unit; it is a 'Packet' at the Network layer.

questions.q: Which model is actually implemented in modern networks?
questions.explanation: While we use OSI for reference, the internet and modern networks run on the TCP/IP stack.

questions.q: Which layer of the OSI model performs encryption and decryption?
questions.explanation: Encryption is a key function of the Presentation layer.

questions.q: The process of removing headers/trailers as data moves up the OSI stack is called:
questions.explanation: Decapsulation is the reverse of encapsulation, occurring at the receiving host.

questions.q: True or False: The OSI model was created by the IEEE.
questions.explanation: It was created by ISO (International Organization for Standardization).

questions.q: True or False: The TCP/IP model has 5 layers.
questions.explanation: The standard TCP/IP model has 4 layers (though some variations use 5).

questions.q: True or False: The Transport layer in OSI is responsible for logical addressing.
questions.explanation: Logical addressing is the responsibility of the Network layer.

questions.q: True or False: Routers operate at the Network layer.
questions.explanation: Routers route packets using Layer 3 (Network) IP addresses.

questions.q: True or False: The Presentation layer handles encryption.
questions.explanation: Data representation, including encryption, is handled at Layer 6.

questions.q: True or False: The Physical layer deals with MAC addressing.
questions.explanation: MAC addressing occurs at the Data Link layer (Layer 2).

questions.q: True or False: The TCP/IP model’s Application layer includes OSI’s Application, Presentation, and Session layers.
questions.explanation: Correct. The TCP/IP Application layer handles all top-level functions.

questions.q: True or False: Encapsulation happens as data moves up the OSI stack.
questions.explanation: Encapsulation happens as data moves DOWN; Decapsulation happens as it moves UP.

questions.q: True or False: The Data Link layer provides end-to-end communication.
questions.explanation: The Data Link layer provides hop-to-hop communication; Transport provides end-to-end.

questions.q: True or False: HTTP is an Application layer protocol in TCP/IP.
questions.explanation: HTTP is one of the most common protocols at the Application layer.
